data.title: City of Charlotte Passport Acceptance Facility
data.meta_description: Looking to take a vacation and need a passport? Book an appointment today with the City of Charlotte Passport Acceptance Facility!
data.text:
U.S. Department of State/Get a Passport.

If you do not want to print the online form, you can obtain the form from the City of Charlotte Passport Acceptance Facility when you come in to apply for the passport. Should you decide to complete the form in our office, you must arrive 15 minutes prior to your scheduled appointment. Should you have more than one applicant in your party, this will apply for them as well.

Should you make an error, carefully mark through the error one time in black ink then legibly write the correction on top or below the error.

NOTE: Do not sign your passport application! You will be required to sign the application after the Passport Acceptance Agent reads your oath.

Save time by having your passport photo taken at the City of Charlotte Passport Acceptance Facility when you present your application!

The fee for a passport photo is $15.00. Payment for the photo is accepted in check or money order only.

Should you choose to have your passport photo taken elsewhere, a single, color photo, meeting the passport photo requirements bellow is required:

Attire:

While uniforms, such as military or police, may not be worn, religious clothing worn daily may be so long as it is not obscuring the face. Except for religious purposes, no hats or head coverings are permitted. A signed statement regarding religious headgear will be requested.

Photo must not show head phones or a wireless device, such us Bluetooth headset or earbuds, with the exception to hearing aids, should they be normally and consistently worn.

Glasses:

Glasses must be removed for a passport photo even if glasses are routinely worn, unless submitting a signed medical statement stating that glasses cannot be removed due to medical reasons. In this case, frames must not cover the eye(s) nor there be glare, shadows, or refraction on eyeglasses that obscure the eye(s).

Pose and Expression:

While a natural smile is accepted, a neutral facial expression is preferred. The subject must be facing the camera and looking straight ahead, with shoulders square to camera, and both eyes open and clearly visible.

Obscuring the Face:

Full face must be visible and free of shadows and without hair or clothing obscuring the face. An accessory or facial decoration is acceptable if it is normally and consistently worn and does not obscure the face, such as: jewelry, piercings, wigs, and hearing aids.

Background:

Must be a plain, white or off-white, shadow-free background with no other person appearing in the photo.

Size, Resolution, and Image Specifications:

The passport photograph must be 2 x 2 inches in size with the image size, being measured from the bottom of the chin to the top of the head (including hair), not be less than one inch or more than 1 3/8 inches.

The photo must be undamaged and have been taken within the past 6 months, without visible pixels, printer dots, or smudges, on matte or glossy quality paper. Photo must have the subject in focus and be sharp with fine detail, while representing a good likeness of the subject.

Lighting, Color, Contrast, and Brightness:

Photos must not contain red eye, shadows on face or background or shine or hotspots.

Lighting must be sufficiently bright so that facial features are clearly visible, with illumination uniformly across the face. Pupils and irises must be clearly visible.

Digital Alteration and Retouching:

Photo cannot be altered, adjusted, retouched, or manipulated, including but not limited to: digital or darkroom techniques such as airbrushing, image enhancing, photo retouching, adjustments to aspect ratio, or adjustments being made to facial features or to the image's background

Head Size and Position:

Head must be centered, facing forward, with the camera not too close or too far away from the subject.

For more information on passport photo requirements, please visit the website of the U.S. Department of State/Passport Photos.
